sentences.en: In Europe, prehistoric tribes sought shelter in caves and later constructed increasingly large and reverberant temples and churches.
sentences.cn: 在欧洲，史前部落在山洞里寻求庇护，后来建造越来越大，越来越混响的庙宇及教堂。

sentences.en: Some of the most reverberant recent studies were performed at Northwestern University’s Feinberg School of Medicine in Chicago.
sentences.cn: 最近的研究中最具反响的一些是在芝加哥西北大学范伯格医学院进行的。

sentences.en: The acoustic image is better balanced and more natural sounding across both direct and reverberant fields.
sentences.cn: 声像在直达声场和混响声场中的声响更加平衡和自然.

sentences.en: The early basilican churches were highly reverberant, even with open windows, and the pace and form of church music had to adjust to the architecture to be understood.
sentences.cn: 早期的巴西利卡教堂高度的回响，当时的音乐的节奏和形式不得因为教堂空间而作出调整，以便人们可以听懂。

sentences.en: To strike so as to produce a loud, reverberant noise.
sentences.cn: 发出打击声敲击使发出砰砰响亮声.

words.tran_cn: 回响；反响；弹回；不断发生后效
回响的；反射的；起回声的

trans.tran_cn: 回响的，回荡的，宏亮的，反射的
